basics.name: Kyla Lee
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2024. My career goal is to become a Project Manger in a computer science company.

work.summary: Tutor for math (up to Calculus II)
highlights: Adapt and adjust to an online Zoom format of customer service
Aid clients of all ages understand the curriculum
Provide good customer service to people from all around the world
Ensure the health and safety of customers through proper food distribution

volunteer.organization: Association for Computing Machinery at UH Manoa (ACManoa/ACM)
volunteer.summary: Project Manage variousteams on the Board
highlights: Coordinated with team members and staff about events

Kalani hosts annual academies as a fundraiser for the robotics team. KRA is a week-long science camp where students from grades 1-8 get to explore science, technology, engineering, mathematics, and computing
It is completely student-run from making the flyers to the lesson plans. I had the opportunity to be the project manager where I learned organization and leadership skills

volunteer.summary: To outreach to other schools and get kids excited about STEM, the robotics team does STEM nights and robot demos for elementary schools.
highlights: Aina Haina Elementary Bristlebot STEM night
St. Patrick Elementary Bristlebot STEM night

awards.title: Regents Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.8. The Regents Scholarship awards full tuition for both Fall and Spring semesters, a $2,000 semester based stipend, and a one-time travel stipend of $2,000 to successful applicants attending University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa (UHM).

awards.title: Engineering Inspiration Award
awards.awarder: For Inspiration and Recognition in Science and Technology (FIRST) Robotics Competition
awards.summary: My team won the Engineering Inspiration Award and a free ticket to the World's Competition in Houston, Texas.  See my portfolio site for more details.

awards.title: 2022 National Honorable Mention
awards.summary: NCWIT supports women in STEM and recognizes those individuals that have a significant impact on their community through STEM and outreach.

awards.title: World's Dean's List Winner
awards.awarder: For Inspiration and Recognition in Science and Technology (FIRST) Tech Challenge
awards.summary: 10 people are selected worldwide for recognition for students leaders who have led their Teams and communities to increased awareness for FIRST and its mission.
